snippet: Although the session was scheduled to end on Wednesday, lawmakers were taking bets on how long it would be extended, and hotels were quickly being booked.
abstract: Several major issues remain unresolved as New York State Legislature reaches official end of session, prompting several lawmakers to book hotels and make bets on how long debate would continue; while extended deadlines are not uncommon in Albany, current chaos has been exacerbated by corruption charges against former Assembly leader Sheldon Silver and former Senate leader Dean G Skelos.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG, JESSE McKINLEY and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Although the session was scheduled to end on Wednesday, lawmakers were taking bets on how long it would be extended, and hotels were quickly being booked.

headline.main: When Will It End? Much Work Is Left as Albany Session Winds Down
headline.print_headline: When Will It End? Much Work Is Left as Albany Session Winds Down
